summary: Ralph Marvin Steinman  was a Canadian immunologist and cell biologist at Rockefeller University.
full_text: Ralph Marvin Steinman  was a Canadian immunologist and cell biologist at Rockefeller University, who in 1973 coined the term dendritic cells while working as a postdoctoral fellow in the laboratory of Zanvil A. Cohn, also at Rockefeller University. Steinman was one of the recipients of the 2011 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine.
title: Ralph Steinman
